name: Ajit Bhawan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fun, quirky hotel that feels a lot like a resort. The entire place feels like it is scattered through tropical gardens.
reviews.title: An Indian Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the rooms surround a large landscaped garden and massive swimming pool that is the focal point of the gardens.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: Our round room was huge with two bathrooms, a separate sitting area, separate bedroom and with a balcony that overlooked the gardens and outdoor dining area and a massive Indian padlock to secure the double doors to our room, quirky but fun. The outdoor dinner buffet is stunning with a huge variety of food to explore - I ate too much.
reviews.title: Simply fabulous

reviews.text: It is not quite as flash as the Palace up the road but then it is a third of the price and you still get your very own Maharajah in residence. You will be totally happy here. And check out the bar, quirky and fun along with the garage of old Maharajah cars that are all available for rent.
reviews.title: The Maharajah Experience

reviews.text: First of all, I need to say that we were upgraded for free to a Deluxe Suite. The room was immense and the bed sheets as white as snow. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The hotel staff was outstanding, and the garden restaurant delicious and romantic. Last but not least, the swimming pool was priceless (given the high temperature and humidity).
reviews.title: Quiet Haven

reviews.text: I cannot find fault with this hotel - the rooms are spacious and clean, the pool is fantastic and the hotel restuarant serves really good food. You can have a western breakfast (if you must) or far better is the Indian option which include the most tasty filled Parottas. Don't be put off by reception which looks like a 19th century hunting lodge. This hotel is a real 5* with all the amenities you might want and is well located for touring the fort and the old town.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel with 5* facilities

reviews.text: They look very appealing until all hell breaks loose. The bed was definitely third world, no support and curved, unbelievable. We had to sleep on the sofa bed halfway into the night.Correction, we didnt sleep, as our room was next to the kitchen they were working...
reviews.title: Not Up To The Mark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a slightly quirky family run hotel but approaching five star quality. Beautiful setting among well tended and pretty gardens. Excekllent staff. Also has pool, spa and restaurant and bar. Breakfasts could have been better as there was not much of a choice for British palates, however, the dinners were superb. Would gladly go there again.
reviews.title: Top Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Palace is "beautiful". with all the amenities and excellent rooms this is by far the best hotel in Jodhpur (except Umaid Bhawan Palace which we didnt see). Interior of every room are different and The J bar is so artistically done that you cant miss to enjoy a drink in this bar. Quality of food in the restaurant is excellent too. we spent 6 nights here and were still craving for more. Location wise too this is nicely located, decently distant from the heart of the city and the fort. we checked out RAAS Haveli, Pal Haveli and Taj Hari Mahal but i think this resort is FAR better than all three of them. You may find service a bit slow but you cant crib whilst on a holiday after all they are not a business hotel. Staff needs little bit of grooming as most of them are hired locally. Even if you are not staying in this resort make it a point to visit this place, i am sure you will not regret.
reviews.title: Most amazing Palace and Resort

reviews.text: You either splurge or be frugal in Jodhpur but i decided to stay here as it was fully booked on my last trip. My room was a suite that faced the swimming pool during dinner time, you could hear the folk songs and music being played. It did not bother me but those who need quiet time, request a room away from the pool and lawn area for dinner.
reviews.title: good heritage hotel

reviews.text: We recently spent a night in this lovely hotel. We stayed in the round rooms which were spotlessly clean and quite spacious. The grounds of the hotel were enormous and beautiful. Even though we didn't use the pool (no time) it looked fantastic.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel

reviews.text: The only downside were the ridiculous padlocks on the door. I didn't find them quirky, I found them annoying.
reviews.title: very nice stay , very nice people

reviews.text: The staff were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the ajit bawan on the 19 th of october with a group of 11 friends , we really enjoyed the location , a little bit outside of the city . Bedrooms are nicely located in a garden . It is ideal for a family trip . Juniors and adult may relax after the visit on the pool side . Service is very nicely done and any one is paying attention to your satisfaction . We liked it a lot
reviews.title: Charming and whimsical heritage hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at Ajit Bhavan at Jodhpur .
reviews.title: pool side room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the hotel is fairly isolated from the town, it is in a quiet garden setting which we enjoyed. The people were very nice and the service very good. Due to the distance from the town, on two warm evenings we ate dinner here. The food was very good, with the desert twist on the usual Indian fare.
reviews.title: Quiet garden setting

reviews.text: The lock on the door was a bit funky, a padlock with a big key, but now I'm just splitting hairs.
reviews.title: The best service I have experienced in India - by a long way!!

reviews.text: Overall a very nice experience.
reviews.title: Great food and a relaxing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really lovely hotel - the staff are extremely well trained and they are really efficient! Our first experience of such service since arriving in India and on previous visits.
reviews.title: weird hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are all different and unique and are set around beautiful landscaped grounds. We were in 206 and it was spacious and really well presented! I got to see many if the rooms as there was a large group of us staying! One a thusly has a tree growing in the middle!!
reviews.title: Great Stay and Great Food.

description: The Ajit Bhawan Palace is the residence, for the family of the younger brother of the Late Maharaja of Jodhpur, Umed Singh Sahib. Built in 1923 for Maharaj Ajit Singh, it exudes the true essence of an oasis with magical powers capable of making the worries of the world simply melt away. The Palace Resort, has the foundation of a legacy that is part of the history behind the city of Jodhpur, it is about achieving a balance between history while enriching your experience through comfort & unique original style. Must have a Joy Ride on Vintage Car when you are in Jodhpur.
